title.narrative: Support for Labour Law and Industrial Relations Reform in Malaysia

description.narrative: In the context of Malaysia's then-possible entrance into the TTP, the overall objective of this project is effective governmental development and enforcement of new or existing laws, decrees or regulations, and other legal instruments, achieving the following outcomes: 1. National government drafts laws, decrees and regulations, and other legal instruments as agreed upon in the consistency plan, with respect to freedom of association, collective bargaining, and employment discrimination; 2. National government educates employers /employers' organizations, workers/workers' organizations, and the public on the laws and regulations; 3. National government undertakes necessary institutional changes and capacity building to implement laws, regulations, and other legal instruments, including improving the efficiency and effectiveness of labor inspections; 4. Relevant criminal system authorities effectively administer and enforce the new laws, decrees and regulations, and other legal instruments enacted by the government as agreed upon in the consistency plan.

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Department of Labor, Departmental Management, Salaries and Expenses

title.narrative: MY Voice: Project to Combat Forced Labor and Child Labor in the Production of Goods in Malaysia

description.narrative: The MY Voice project will combat forced labor and child labor in the garment and palm oil industries in Malaysia in three main ways: 1) building the capacity of workers and civil society organizations to advocate for labor rights; 2) elevating the role of worker voice in private sector social compliance systems in these industries; and 3) increasing access to remedies for workers exploited for forced labor or child labor.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Department of Labor, Departmental Management, Salaries and Expenses

description.narrative: The MY Voice project will combat forced labor and child labor in the garment and palm oil industries in Malaysia in three main ways: 1) building the capacity of workers and civil society organizations to advocate for labor rights; 2) elevating the role of worker voice in private sector social compliance systems in these industries; and 3) increasing access to remedies for workers exploited for forced labor or child labor.
